result.execSummary:
The defendant Gilberto Otero-Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 11.12.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11.12.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming;
Absolute sobriety and random urine screens;

timeConds.notes: Release for work, medical appointments, mental health treatment and drug treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gilberto Otero-Cruz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 9/8/15 ck #335527 was returned by USPS unable to forward.  at

9/11/15 surety called Customer Service and provided additional address info "Upper".  Note:  "Upper" does not appear on any paperwork for the surety.  A refund notice will be mailed on 9/14/15 to verify the surety's address.  at
8/19/15 Bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.
Defendant Gilberto Otero-Cruz in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is amending report date ONLY, defendant to report on 9/8/15.

Defendant Gilberto Otero-Cruz in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank .    All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Gilberto Otero-Cruz in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-30-2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Gilberto Otero-Cruz in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Denis Stingl for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/7/15.

15RM017654  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/01/2015

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Damian C.; Marcos C. or Ramon M.

Defendant Gilberto Otero-Cruz in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Gilberto Otero-Cruz in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defense moves to dismiss for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
